title: WHIG Coordinates Post-Vote Intelligence Suppression Campaign
summary: Following the successful Iraq authorization vote, WHIG coordinates a systematic campaign to suppress contradictory intelligence that might undermine the war narrative. This involves pressuring intelligence agencies to suppress dissenting analysis and intimidating potential whistleblowers.
significance: Demonstrates a coordinated effort to manipulate intelligence narratives, revealing systemic institutional corruption in decision-making processes surrounding the Iraq War.

sources.outlet: George Washington University National Security Archive
sources.title: U.S. Intelligence and Iraq WMD: Intelligence Community Documents Show Pressure from Vice President's Office
